runs.comm: full around middle and leg, punched back to the bowler
further towards leg stump, goes to flick it away and gets struck on the pad, was going down

and this goes straight through Levi's attempted drive and flicks out leg stump, what a start for Doherty. He seemed to get outside leg stump, exposing all three, this time trying to drive a good length ball into the covers, but it skidded on past his stroke and cleaned him up, the miserable run continues for Levi
and drives his first ball from off stump down to long off
leg stump and clipped out to deep square
back of a length and punched into the covers
length just outside off stump, left alone
gets across his stumps and flicks a full ball well timed straight to the deep square fielder
angled across the right-hander, Kallis goes to drive and gets an inside edge towards midwicket, sign of the pace of this wicket
this is certainly an indication of the pace of the wicket, this is back of a length, Kallis goes to pull and is there too soon, gets hit on the body
full ball just outside off, didn't seem to be perfectly timed, but gets it down the ground for four, had to slightly drag it but effective
more conventional, coming forward and punching a length ball to mid off, the take a quick single

oh edged and gone and Doherty gets another. It's a cracking delivery, tossed up on a length just outside off, Kallis pushed at it and got a thin edge to Wade to held the chance very well, it was a decent edge. What a start for Doherty, what a selection. Beautifully bowled, flighted nicely and a little turn this time gets the edge of Kallis
back on the off stump blocking
back again, this time clipped into midwicket
floated up again but Amla gives himself a little bit of room and lifts it over extra cover and it flies into the stands, awesome timing, picked up from off stump, heavens is this guy in good touch
dragged down a little short, the cut stroke only finds cover point
step down the track, fired into the pads, Amla adjusts and digs it out towards long off
well bowled, little bit of shape in from just outside off, blocked back to the bowler from a length
full of a good length, cut and missed at
good drive to cover point, oh there's a huge mix up, a direct hit and Duminy is miles out, but the throw is so far wide of the one-stump Hussey had to aim at, lucky that for SA
doesn't adjust to the leftie and send it down leg
good length just outside off, driven on the up to backward point on the front foot
just outside off on a similar length, again forward to drive, mistimed to mid off
fuller and this drive finds the gap between point and cover and runs to the rope
back of a length around off stump, blocked into the covers, into the gap for a single
nicely bowled, yorker length just outside off, dug out and they refuse the wicket single, perhaps with remembering the run out of Gambhir the other night
back of a length, a little straight, dangerous with long leg up, tried to help it around the corner, got it off the glove to the fielder
gives himself room and edges a length delivery past short long leg for four. Lucky that, tried to go through the off side but got a big edge
step across the stumps, flicks a full ball off middle to the deep square leg
back of a length, clipped wide of the 45 for a single
length just outside off, driven off an inside edge to midwicket
just outside off, driven off a big outside edge down to third man
back of a length on leg stump, a shuffle across the crease and tucked wide of the 45
back of a length again, punched to cover

step across the stumps, goes to pull and gloved behind! Amla falls and Watson does the job again. A shorter ball, again not coming on as the batsman might expect, Amla went across his stumps to pull into the leg side, but was through with the stroke too soon and gloved a ball to Wade and walked straight off, what a blow for Australia
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man
back of a length around off stump, blocked back to the bowler
again going back and trying to drive off the back foot but mistimes it to mid on
big bumper, ignored, that had good carry though, went through nicely
much fuller, forward and driven out to the cover sweeper
forward and a fine drive past extra cover, this is well timed, played really well that
similar length, tighter line to off stump, Duminy opens the face and gets it to third man
played from the crease towards mid on, wide enough for a scampered single
down the wicket to a ball tossed up around off stump, clipped down to long on
slightly too short and whipped out to the midwicket boundary, placed very well
touch fuller, clipped into the vacant midwicket area again, Hogg chases and fields himself
that was the googly, de Villiers waited for it and clipped it through the on side
length ball just outside off, goes down for the reverse sweep and misses, half a cry for a catch behind of the glove, didn't need to go down to reverse that
tossed up turns a bit, kept out back to the bowler
full ball, tapped to midwicket, Duminy is sent back, a direct hit but Duminy was back, the ball ricochets away for a single after all
full ball just outside off, driven to mid off
short and pulled wide of long leg, the slower nature of the pitch should make those short balls easier to put away today, got on top of it nicely and helped it behind square
full length just outside off, carved down to third man
the very annoying de Villiers wait-wait-wait-dab to third man, I say annoying because I feel he often misses out on hittable balls doing that
well bowled, a little shape in to the off stump, dabbed down towards point and they take a single
full ball on off stump, flicked out towards deep midwicket
back of a length around off stump, clipped down to long on
on the front foot, clipped through midwicket
tucked behind square on the leg side with a flick wide of the 45
short outside off, dragged to deep midwicket, poor ball got away with it
floated up onto leg stump, rolled into the on side

and gets another one straight away! Duminy down the track gets beaten and is stumped by a country mile. More lovely flight by Doherty, drew Duminy down the pitch and he was no where near it, tried to adjust, I think the ball ended up going between his legs and my grandfather could have made that stumping with a cup of tea in one hand and a scone in the other
floated up nicely again, middle stump, pushed past the bowler down to long off
floated up again, no afraid to do so and why not, clipped down to long on
off stump line, very full, dug out to extra cover who slides and saves well
waited for and pushed out to point from the crease
another ball played from the crease, just ran back to the bowler
clipped with the spin out to deep midwicket
played with the turn again from just outside off to deep midwicket
googly, waited for in the crease having gone across the stumps, pushed through midwicket
floated up just outside off stump, again clipped with the turn via midwicket into the deep
just outside off, driven to the off side this time, pretty well timed and Bailey lets it past him at extra cover, no real damage as long off comes round
another googly, waited for and played to leg
length around off stump, clipped through the covers
straighter now, tucked to long leg
gave himself room outside leg stump, carved down to third man from a length around middle
pushed to extra cover, non-striker quickly sent back
excellent short ball from around the wicket, follows de Villiers as he tries to back away and play the ramp, missed
fuller, gets it off the hip towards square leg
floated up, a step to leg and a step back, goes down the leg side under the keeper's legs
step down the wicket and tucked through square leg
outside off, tried to stay in the crease and flick it away, missed
tossed up further, clipped down the ground, Doherty's dive isn't in time and a single runs to long on
step to leg, backed away and cut to extra cover
forward outside off, an awkward flick across the line to deep midwicket
tried to play into the off side from off stump, got an inside edge into the on side for a single

or not as the case may be! De Villiers slaps this straight to extra cover and is caught easily! It was a slower ball on middle stump, de Villiers backed away to try and go over the off side but misread the pace of the ball and could only chip it straight to the fielder who claimed a simple chance at chest height
full, outside off, driven past point to the sweeper
full just outside off, calmly played to mid off
but the batsman responds and goes up and over mid off for four, poor ball considering the field, struck well enough
outside off, more length this time, tucked to point
straighter, clipped out through square leg
turns down the leg side, past the keeper and they take a bonus run
now we saw Peterson do this against England briefly, a big switch hit, changed his hands, times it pretty well and evades the dive of the cover sweeper
now turns himself totally around and ends up slapped it down to long on, definitely saw that against England
floated up towards middle and leg, pushed into the off side
outside off, blocked back to the bowler, waiting for the turn
googly now, flicked away past point
goes for another switch hit and another good connection, picks the gap too between point and short third man
full just outside off, punched down to long on
full sliding across the leftie, blocked back towards the bowler, he was late on it
full and wide outside off stump, drive misses, well bowled that
goes for a big swing this time to a full ball from around off stump and gets an edge past the stumps towards the keeper, no run again
full once more, clipped out to deep point, so at least gets off strike
slower ball onto the off stump, turned through square leg
full and punched down to long off
full and wide, slapped out to deep cover
went full and wide but got it too wide of off stump
length and driven out past cover into the deep
oh dear, a loose delivery for the first time in ages, full toss outside off, whacked wide of long on and finds the rope on the bounce
goes the ramp moving across the off stump, gets hit on the pad from a full ball
full ball, driven to extra cover, there's a fumble towards long off which allows them the second, poor work from Cameron White
super delivery, quick and very full just outside off, can't get a bat on that
wide of off stump again, a swing on the front foot gets a whirl of an edge over point down to third man
wide of off stump again, very wide but reached for and cut at, gets an edge past the keeper to third man
short ball, hooked at, comes off the gloves and balloons over the keeper's head for four
bumper again and...ducked? What on earth. Behardien swing the bat man, playing for his average here
good change of pace, it cuts down the leg side past Behardien's attempted swing to leg, called wide! Very harsh call, moved a long way from outside off that
and this extra ball goes out of the park, full toss outside off, and finally Behardien plays a shot in anger, swinging this wide of long on
full outside off stump, stepping across the stumps it's swung away to the leg side fence past midwicket
goes extra cover this time and it's away for four more! Great innings this, step to leg and cracked pact extra cover
full ball, gets the length right now, right in the block hole, evades the swipe to leg and through to the keeper
around the wicket, steps outside off and ramped to the fine leg fence, lovely execution, picked up really well that
slower ball outside off, a huge swing from outside off is nowhere near but they go through for a bye to the keeper
length outside off, slapped to extra cover, no real effort to get that any further from Behardien
